guide.title: Gentoo-Stats.org - Gentoo Buildtime and Statistics
guide.abstract:
This document describes the Gentoo Stats project, a subproject of the Gentoo Tools top level project. The goal of the Gentoo Stats project is to build a client server application that collects data about the Gentoo software distribution and its users.
Currently our biggest contributor and developer in training is the author of www.gentoo-stats.org, which is currently not considered an official Gentoo project. Nevertheless every developer or user is invited to contribute code and to help improve and audit all contributed code, thereby ensuring the engineering process for this Gentoo project is transparent and leads to software that has been verified to meet Gentoo's high engineering standards.
Since www.gentoo-stats.org serves as the semi-official experimental statistics database in the meantime, a short description of the project is included on this page. This page will also be updated in the near future with a roadmap for the currently unofficial project.

body.p: The goal of this non-Gentoo project was to create an advanced version of the (currently unmaintained) stats.gentoo.org. This project has been written from scratch, feature enhancements to the old stats.gentoo.org include the ability to estimate the time needed for a package to be build on any given system. This tool also allows users to submit screenshot, xorg.conf and kernel configs to a moderated central repository.
The first unofficial version of this project was available in July 2004. The privacy policy for the project can be found on its webpage.
